body: Thanks for starting the discussion in the dev list. I explained the minor issue with one of the test changes. Letâ€™s give 48hrs for comments before proceeding.
@markusthoemmes Please hold this merge. We had to increase  compile memory for the tests "A LOT (from 1 to 3GB) and want to understand more what is going on.
@mhenke1 What were the symptoms you've seen? Stackoverflows?
This is now ready to merge.
Can we remove the WIP for this PR? I think this is now ready to go.
Can I get a WIP tag on this PR?

Thanks @rabbah, @chetanmeh and @selfxp for the feedback. Based on your feedback, I modified below - 

- More defensive checks when parsing the result response. 
  - if the result response contains an `error` field, check if it has `statusCode` defined by the user, as other fields are discarded if the `error` field is present in result response. 
     ```json
     "result": {
            "error": {
                "body": "Authentication credentials are invalid.",
                "statusCode": 401
            }
        }
     ````
  - else check if `statusCode` is set by the user without the `error` field in the result response.
     ```json
     "result": {
                "body": "Authentication credentials are invalid.",
                "statusCode": 401
        }
     ````
  - `statusCode` value is being checked for valid integer (401) and string value ("401").
  -  If there is any issue in getting the `intValue` (i.e. `statusCode` like "i401" or any string "xyz") return set `userDefinedStatusCode as `400`. 
  - Using `value.convertTo[BigInt].intValue()` takes care of `JSNumber` and `JSString` type. I tried alternate approach like handling the status code for webaction https://github.com/apache/openwhisk/blob/master/core/controller/src/main/scala/org/apache/openwhisk/core/controller/WebActions.scala#L234, but for normal action use case it will miss a case where return `statusCode` is a valid integer (like "1") but not a http statusCode.
-  Changed `actionStatusCode` to `userDefinedStatusCode` as `statusCode` is not limited to http status codes. Please let me know if you have any better suggestions. 
-  Other tests and doc changes per feedback. 

Please let me know your feedback.
oh wow this really shrunk! lgtm.

https://github.com/apache/openwhisk/issues/4630 Removes the zip and jar files in test/dat. Some of the files referenced above are not used in this repo and should move to their proper home. Iâ€™ve taken liberties in deleting them. 

With the pr these files are left:
```
tests/dat/actions/unicode.tests/ballerina-0.990.bin: application/octet-stream; charset=binary
tests/dat/actions/unicode.tests/dotnet-2.2.bin: application/zip; charset=binary
tests/dat/actions/unicode.tests/java-8.bin: application/zip; charset=binary
tests/performance/gatling_tests/src/gatling/resources/data/javaAction.jar: application/java-archive; charset=binary)
```

iirc the ballerina Unicode test could just use the source version. Similarly we can use java source for the java Unicode test although there is a gradle file so we can just run gradlew and get the jar. 

The dotnet sources for the Unicode test are also in the repo so we need a way to build this action. @shawnallen85 whats is the most a convenient way to build this test artifact from source?

That leaves the Gatling test. I havenâ€™t looked into it but it should be manageable.
when action returns an value that cannot be parsed to a json object, it also destroy the container, whether this should be changed too?

I think json object is part of the required protocol at both invoker and runtimes, so making that change is significantly larger. Maybe more generically, this should be a question of whether runtime response that is not 200 status should cause container destruction?
I'm not saying it isn't worth discussing, but it is definitely a larger change so I would suggest using a different PR and/or issue to pursue it.
+1 for subsequent PR. I think in keeping with the spirit of this change we should widen the scope of errors that keep the container around.
okðŸ˜ƒ

I committed a build from source for Java. I first attempted to run from source but the java 8 runtime we're publishing isn't the action loop version so it requires a JAR. :/ The build script will make sure java 8 is available since the versions must match.

Rather than figure out how to build Ballerina and Dotnet from source, I just removed them. The unicode test is checked anyway in the action runtime basic tests.

That leaves the Gatling test. Will just build it from source like the unicode test.
Now gatling test is build from source also. I think that's that then.

The ansible and kube deployments are intended for high availability and scalability. They are used at scale in a number of organizations. We can probably do better with documentation. I'll open a separate issue with actionable work after some more consolidation.

OpenWhisk is the closest open source FaaS platform to AWS lambda in terms of cold start and execution life cycle. In fact in some cases it's even faster. Any performance comparison will be against a hosted deployment and configuration that requires both a benchmarking methodology and a calibration for comparable resources (can't compare an openwhisk deployment with 2 invokers to AWS lambda with hundreds of servers). So a meaningful head to head will be against a hosted provider. 

That said, we have added performance benchmarks in the tests folder (using gatling and owperf). There are several academic papers that also look at the performance of openwhisk. Send a note to the Apache dev list for references.
